issue.title: readline issues when migrating from Python3.11 to Python3.12 (macOS)
issue.body:
## Expected Behavior

Executing `xonsh` should work in python3.11 as it was in python3.12 - no errors.

## Current Behavior

When executing `xonsh` I get the following message:

```
******************************************************************************
libedit detected - readline will not be well behaved, including but not limited to:
   * crashes on tab completion
   * incorrect history navigation
   * corrupting long-lines
   * failure to wrap or indent lines properly

It is highly recommended that you install gnureadline, which is installable with:
     xpip install gnureadline
******************************************************************************
```

In addition, I failed to install `gnureadline` on my macOS Sonoma (Apple Silicon).

## For community
⬇️  **Please click the 👍 reaction instead of leaving a `+1` or 👍  comment**

comment.body:
We don't have explicit support for Python 3.12 and maybe you're using a nested fstring in your `xonshrc`?

As for the second error, you can silence those using the `warnings` module, e.g.

```
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")  # this can be more specific
```

The `prompt_toolkit` backend has more features and if `prompt_toolkit` is installed, `xonsh` will default to that backend.  If you want to try `gnureadline`, you can either start xonsh with `--shell-type readline` or uninstall `prompt_toolkit`.

issue.title: readline issues when migrating from Python3.11 to Python3.12 (macOS)
issue.body:
## Expected Behavior

Executing `xonsh` should work in python3.11 as it was in python3.12 - no errors.

## Current Behavior

When executing `xonsh` I get the following message:

```
******************************************************************************
libedit detected - readline will not be well behaved, including but not limited to:
   * crashes on tab completion
   * incorrect history navigation
   * corrupting long-lines
   * failure to wrap or indent lines properly

It is highly recommended that you install gnureadline, which is installable with:
     xpip install gnureadline
******************************************************************************
```

In addition, I failed to install `gnureadline` on my macOS Sonoma (Apple Silicon).

## For community
⬇️  **Please click the 👍 reaction instead of leaving a `+1` or 👍  comment**

comment.body: Updating I could also install `gnureadline` (somehow wasn't before, maybe updating the xcode solved this issue). Still it looks like it uses prompt_toolkit as the backend since the error persists.

issue.title: readline issues when migrating from Python3.11 to Python3.12 (macOS)
issue.body:
## Expected Behavior

Executing `xonsh` should work in python3.11 as it was in python3.12 - no errors.

## Current Behavior

When executing `xonsh` I get the following message:

```
******************************************************************************
libedit detected - readline will not be well behaved, including but not limited to:
   * crashes on tab completion
   * incorrect history navigation
   * corrupting long-lines
   * failure to wrap or indent lines properly

It is highly recommended that you install gnureadline, which is installable with:
     xpip install gnureadline
******************************************************************************
```

In addition, I failed to install `gnureadline` on my macOS Sonoma (Apple Silicon).

## For community
⬇️  **Please click the 👍 reaction instead of leaving a `+1` or 👍  comment**

comment.body:
I installed `prompt_toolkit` which resolved this issue. 
This does cause an error though this time it's on `prompt_toolkit` and `xonsh`:

```
doron@MacBook-Pro ~ @ python3.12 -m xonsh
xonsh: For full traceback set: $XONSH_SHOW_TRACEBACK = True
RuntimeError: Unsupported fstring syntax
Failed to load xontrib up.
/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.12/lib/python3.12/site-packages/prompt_toolkit/application/application.py:961: DeprecationWarning: There is no current event loop
  loop = asyncio.get_event_loop()
```

When enabling debugging it results in the very not readable output:


issue.title: readline issues when migrating from Python3.11 to Python3.12 (macOS)
issue.body:
## Expected Behavior

Executing `xonsh` should work in python3.11 as it was in python3.12 - no errors.

## Current Behavior

When executing `xonsh` I get the following message:

```
******************************************************************************
libedit detected - readline will not be well behaved, including but not limited to:
   * crashes on tab completion
   * incorrect history navigation
   * corrupting long-lines
   * failure to wrap or indent lines properly

It is highly recommended that you install gnureadline, which is installable with:
     xpip install gnureadline
******************************************************************************
```

In addition, I failed to install `gnureadline` on my macOS Sonoma (Apple Silicon).

## For community
⬇️  **Please click the 👍 reaction instead of leaving a `+1` or 👍  comment**

comment.body: @doronz88 -- do you usually use the readline prompt or the `prompt_toolkit` one?  Is `gnureadline` unavailable for Apple Silicon?

issue.title: history errors when using `sudo`
issue.body:
## Expected Behavior

Open xonsh shell:

```shell
ori@Oris-Mac-mini ~ @ sudo -s
ori@Oris-Mac-mini ~ @ ls # or any other command
```

Open another xonsh shell without getting history errors

## Current Behavior

Open xonsh shell:

```shell
ori@Oris-Mac-mini ~ @ sudo -s
ori@Oris-Mac-mini ~ @ ls # or any other command
```

Open another xonsh shell and getting:

```
ori@Oris-Mac-mini ~ @ Exception in thread Thread-6 (_in_load_thread):
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python@3.10/3.10.10_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.10/lib/python3.10/threading.py", line 1016, in _bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python@3.10/3.10.10_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.10/lib/python3.10/threading.py", line 953, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/prompt_toolkit/history.py", line 188, in _in_load_thread
    for item in self.history.load_history_strings():
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/xonsh/ptk_shell/history.py", line 28, in load_history_strings
    for cmd in hist.all_items(newest_first=True):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/xonsh/history/json.py", line 551, in all_items
    json_file = xlj.LazyJSON(f, reopen=False)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/xonsh/lazyjson.py", line 208, in __init__
    self._f = open(f, newline="\n")
PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/Users/ori/.local/share/xonsh/history_json/xonsh-c9eb8d70-1859-4324-955b-48a7b3b1715f.json'
```

This happens because the history files have only root access. I suggest these files will be `chmod`-ed to `777`?

## Steps to Reproduce

- sudo in your existing xonsh session
- execute several commands
- open another shell instance

## For community
⬇️  **Please click the 👍 reaction instead of leaving a `+1` or 👍  comment**

commits.message: history: fix json file permissions upon `sudo` (#5220) (#5221)

pull_request.title: history: fix json file permissions upon `sudo` (#5220)
pull_request.body:
Close #5220

issue.title: termios.error after invoking subprocess in pythonanywhere
issue.body:
I'm attempting to use xonsh on pythonanywhere.com.

I've used pipx to install xonsh:

```
pipx install 'xonsh[ptk]'
```

When I run a built-in command like `xonfig`, the process proceeds, but if I invoke a subprocess like `ls`, the shell crashes after executing the command.

Even though it says "fallback to /bin/sh", the terminal hangs unresponsive.

If I run without `ptk` (i.e. readline), the issue does not occur, so the issue may in fact lie upstream in prompt_toolkit.

For now, I'm running with readline, but I wanted to register the issue.

## xonfig

<details>

```
$ xonfig
+------------------+-----------------+
| xonsh            | 0.14.1          |
| Python           | 3.9.5           |
| PLY              | 3.11            |
| have readline    | True            |
| prompt toolkit   | 3.0.39          |
| shell type       | prompt_toolkit  |
| history backend  | json            |
| pygments         | None            |
| on posix         | True            |
| on linux         | True            |
| distro           | unknown         |
| on wsl           | False           |
| on darwin        | False           |
| on windows       | False           |
| on cygwin        | False           |
| on msys2         | False           |
| is superuser     | False           |
| default encoding | utf-8           |
| xonsh encoding   | utf-8           |
| encoding errors  | surrogateescape |
| xontrib 1        | voxapi          |
| xontrib 2        | vox             |
| RC file          | []              |
+------------------+-----------------+
```

</details>

## Expected Behavior
<!--- Tell us what should happen -->

## Current Behavior

```
jaraco@blue-liveconsole11 ~ @ ls .local
bin  lib  pipx  share
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jaraco/.local/pipx/venvs/xonsh/lib/python3.9/site-packages/xonsh/main.py", line 469, in main
    sys.exit(main_xonsh(args))
  File "/home/jaraco/.local/pipx/venvs/xonsh/lib/python3.9/site-packages/xonsh/main.py", line 513, in main_xonsh
    shell.shell.cmdloop()
  File "/home/jaraco/.local/pipx/venvs/xonsh/lib/python3.9/site-packages/xonsh/ptk_shell/shell.py", line 401, in cmdloop
    line = self.singleline(auto_suggest=auto_suggest)
  File "/home/jaraco/.local/pipx/venvs/xonsh/lib/python3.9/site-packages/xonsh/ptk_shell/shell.py", line 369, in singleline
    line = self.prompter.prompt(**prompt_args)
  File "/home/jaraco/.local/pipx/venvs/xonsh/lib/python3.9/site-packages/prompt_toolkit/shortcuts/prompt.py", line 1024, in prompt
    return self.app.run(
  File "/home/jaraco/.local/pipx/venvs/xonsh/lib/python3.9/site-packages/prompt_toolkit/application/application.py", line 967, in run
    return loop.run_until_complete(coro)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/asyncio/base_events.py", line 642, in run_until_complete
    return future.result()
  File "/home/jaraco/.local/pipx/venvs/xonsh/lib/python3.9/site-packages/prompt_toolkit/application/application.py", line 881, in run_async
    return await _run_async(f)
  File "/home/jaraco/.local/pipx/venvs/xonsh/lib/python3.9/site-packages/prompt_toolkit/application/application.py", line 732, in _run_async
    with self.input.raw_mode(), self.input.attach(
  File "/home/jaraco/.local/pipx/venvs/xonsh/lib/python3.9/site-packages/prompt_toolkit/input/vt100.py", line 258, in __enter__
    termios.tcsetattr(self.fileno, termios.TCSANOW, newattr)
termios.error: (5, 'Input/output error')
Xonsh encountered an issue during launch
Failback to /bin/sh
```

### Traceback (if applicable)

<details>

```
traceback
```

</details>

issue.title: history errors when using `sudo`
issue.body:
## Expected Behavior

Open xonsh shell:

```shell
ori@Oris-Mac-mini ~ @ sudo -s
ori@Oris-Mac-mini ~ @ ls # or any other command
```

Open another xonsh shell without getting history errors

## Current Behavior

Open xonsh shell:

```shell
ori@Oris-Mac-mini ~ @ sudo -s
ori@Oris-Mac-mini ~ @ ls # or any other command
```

Open another xonsh shell and getting:

```
ori@Oris-Mac-mini ~ @ Exception in thread Thread-6 (_in_load_thread):
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python@3.10/3.10.10_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.10/lib/python3.10/threading.py", line 1016, in _bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python@3.10/3.10.10_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.10/lib/python3.10/threading.py", line 953, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/prompt_toolkit/history.py", line 188, in _in_load_thread
    for item in self.history.load_history_strings():
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/xonsh/ptk_shell/history.py", line 28, in load_history_strings
    for cmd in hist.all_items(newest_first=True):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/xonsh/history/json.py", line 551, in all_items
    json_file = xlj.LazyJSON(f, reopen=False)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/xonsh/lazyjson.py", line 208, in __init__
    self._f = open(f, newline="\n")
PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/Users/ori/.local/share/xonsh/history_json/xonsh-c9eb8d70-1859-4324-955b-48a7b3b1715f.json'
```

This happens because the history files have only root access. I suggest these files will be `chmod`-ed to `777`?

## Steps to Reproduce

- sudo in your existing xonsh session
- execute several commands
- open another shell instance

## For community
⬇️  **Please click the 👍 reaction instead of leaving a `+1` or 👍  comment**
